description.narrative: The project aims to develop the potential of religious education in schools in Indonesia for the purpose of peace and fight against violence and extremism.

sector.narrative: Build resilience to shocks and crisis

description.narrative: 1.1 Enhanced knowledge on the most recent religious attitudes and behaviors of students, teachers and university students 1.2 Enhanced knowledge on the most recent degree of students, teachers and university students’ support for radicalism or radical religious movements, pro-violence ideologies and extremism 2.1 The increase of public policies to prevent the spread of certain attitudes and violent behavior, extremism and radicalism in schools, university and colleges and other educational institutions 2.2 The increased involvement of students, teachers and communities in counteracting the spread of certain attitudes and violent behavior, extremism and radicalism 3.1 The widespread of tolerant, open and peaceful religious values to strengthen Indonesian inclusive society 3.2 The increased public awareness on the importance of tolerant, open and peaceful religious values to strengthen Indonesian inclusive society 4.1 Projects plans smoothly implemented and financial accountability ensured 4.2 Results of the project shared with government, civil societies, development partners, and other Asian countries

comment.narrative: 1.1 4 available researches (2008, 2010, 2011, 2015) 1.2 4 available researches (2008, 2010, 2011, 2015) 2.1 4 advocacy events (2011, 2014, 2015, 2016) 2.2 4 policy engagement activities (2011, 2014, 2015, 2016) 3.1 3 youth camp program (2011, 2013, 2015) None conducted by UNDP 3.2 3 media campaign events (2011, 2013, 2015) None distributed UNDP 4.1 Projects plans smoothly implemented and financial accountability ensured: 0 4.2 Results of the project shared with government, civil societies, development partners, and other Asian countries: 0
No target. This output ended in 2018.
No results. This output ended in 2018.

Output 1 Development of evidence-based knowledge through research and survey on Countering Violent Extremism in a gender sensitive approach: 1.1 Enhanced knowledge on the most recent religious attitudes and behaviors of students, teachers and university students and 1.2 Enhanced knowledge on the most recent degree of students, teachers and university students’ support for radicalism or radical religious movements, pro-violence ideologies and extremism.
Output 2 Strengthened Advocacy and Policy Engagement on Countering Violent Extremism: 2.1 The increase of public policies to prevent the spread of certain attitudes and violent behavior, extremism and radicalism in schools, university and colleges and other educational institutions and 2.2 The increased involvement of students, teachers and communities in counteracting the spread of certain attitudes and violent behavior, extremism and radicalism.
Output 3 Increased public awareness and knowledge on Countering Violent Extremism: 3.1 The widespread of tolerant, open and peaceful religious values to strengthen Indonesian inclusive society and 3.2 The increased public awareness on the importance of tolerant, open and peaceful religious values to strengthen Indonesian inclusive society.
Output 4 Project implementation quality is assured and proper coordination mechanism established among relevant stakeholders: 4.1 Projects plans smoothly implemented and financial accountability ensured and 4.2 Results of the project shared with government, civil societies, development partners, and other Asian countries.

sensitive approach developed, as indicated by 1.1 Enhanced knowledge on the most recent religious attitudes and behaviors of students, teachers and university students through production of two (2) research and one (1) survey on the most recent religious attitudes and behaviors of students, teachers and university students. 1.2 Enhanced knowledge on the most recent degree of students, teachers and university students’ support for radicalism or radical religious movements, pro-violence ideologies and extremism through production of one (1) research and one (1) database on the most recent degree of students, teachers and university students’ support for radicalism or radical religious movements, pro-violence ideologies and extremism.
Output 2 Strengthened Advocacy and Policy Engagement on Countering Violent Extremism, as indicated by: 2.1 The increase of public policies to prevent the spread of certain attitudes and violent behavior, extremism and radicalism in schools, university and colleges and other educational institutions through development of seven advocacy (7) measures. 2.2 The increased involvement of students, teachers and communities in counteracting the spread of certain attitudes and violent behavior, extremism and radicalism through two (2) policy engagement activities on CVE
Output 3 Increased public awareness and knowledge on Countering Violent Extremism, as indicated by: 3.1 The widespread of tolerant, open and peaceful religious values to strengthen Indonesian inclusive society by conducting 8 public campaigns conducted including three youth camps. 3.2 The increased public awareness on the importance of tolerant, open and peaceful religious values to strengthen Indonesian inclusive society by conducting 8 public campaigns conducted including three youth camps.
Output 4 Project implementation quality is assured and proper coordination mechanism established among relevant stakeholders, as indicated by: 4.1 Projects plans smoothly implemented and financial accountability ensured through 7 monthly coordination meetings, submission of 4 QMRs and 1 final report 4.2 Results of the project shared with government, civil societies, development partners, and other Asian countries through 4 Quarterly Roundtable meetings, 1 Regional workshop, 5 monitoring visits with PB members, and 4 Project Board meetings
